meanings.definition: To connect or link together in a chain or series.
meanings.sent1: The children interchained their hands to form a human chain.
meanings.sent2: The workers interchained the metal links to create a sturdy fence.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels interchained their tails playfully while climbing the tree.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky seemed to be interchained, creating a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The beads were interchained in a unique design on the necklace.

meanings.definition: To exchange or swap positions in a sequence.
meanings.sent1: The players interchained their positions on the field during the game.
meanings.sent2: The cars interchained lanes smoothly to avoid traffic congestion.
meanings.sent3: The students interchained seats in class as a prank on the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The dancers interchained partners gracefully during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The birds interchained flight paths in a mesmerizing aerial display.
